Yes, here are some contemporary novels that explore race and social class in a unique and futuristic way:

1. "Parable of the Sower" by Octavia Butler - Set in a near-future dystopian society, this novel explores issues of race, poverty, and gender inequality through the eyes of a young Black woman who must lead her community to survival.

2. "Binti" by Nnedi Okorafor - This science fiction novella follows a young African girl as she travels to attend an intergalactic university and faces issues of discrimination and racial bias.

3. "The Power" by Naomi Alderman - In this speculative fiction novel, women suddenly develop the ability to control electrical impulses with their bodies, which leads to a shift in power dynamics and explores issues of gender, race, and class.

4. "The Water Dancer" by Ta-Nehisi Coates - This historical novel blends elements of magical realism and explores the life of a young enslaved man who discovers he has a superhuman power and seeks to use his ability to fight for justice and freedom.

5. "Zone One" by Colson Whitehead - Set in a post-apocalyptic New York City, this novel explores issues of race and class through the eyes of a Black man who is part of a team responsible for clearing out the remaining zombies in the city.

These are just a few examples, but there are many other great novels that explore race and social class through a unique and futuristic lens.
